intro: Pedicularis eriophora, commonly known as the narrowleaf lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
